content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a simple way to do it using regular expressions:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks, excluding fences and joining them into one string with newline
    matches = collect(eachmatch(r"```(.*?)```", md))
    if isempty(matches) 
        return ""
    end
    
    code_blocks = mapreduce((m -> m.captures[1]), vcat, matches) do s
        replace(s, r"^```julia\n|\n```$" => "", s => "\n")
    end
    
    return join(code_blocks, "\n")
end
```

The function `extract_julia_code` will find all matches of code blocks in the markdown document (excluding fences), then removes all fencing and newline characters from each match. The resulting strings are joined together with a newline to create the final output. If no code blocks were found, an empty string is returned.
